items.subject: Verborgene Helden
items.description: Interview mit General Wilhelm Mohnke , LSSAH -Ritterkreuzträger, Rundsburg, 1990. Mohnke wurde von Adolf Hitler persönlich zum Kommandanten für die Verteidigung des zentralen Regierungsviertels von Berlin (Verteidigungssektor „Zitadelle“) ernannt. Diese wichtige Aufgabe umfasste auch die Reichskanzlei und den Führerbunker. Dies veranlasste ihn, die Kampfgruppe Mohnke zu bilden, die sich aus verschiedenen SS-Gruppen zusammensetzte. Ihr Kern waren die legendären 800 Mann der Leibstandarte (LSSAH), des SS-Wachbataillons, der persönlichen Garde Adolf Hitlers.  Das PDF enthält zusätzlich noch die Übersetzung der Empfehlungen für das Ritterkreuz .
items.title: Wilhelm Mohnke (General, RK, LSSAH)

General Wilhelm Mohnke
items.description: Verborgene Helden: Die Reise eines Soldaten auf der Suche nach der Wahrheit Interview mit General Wilhelm Mohnke, LSSAH-Ritterkreuzträger, Rundsburg, 1990. Mohnke wurde von Adolf Hitler persönlich zum Kommandanten für die Verteidigung des zentralen Regierungsviertels von Berlin (Verteidigungssektor „Zitadelle“) ernannt. Diese wichtige Aufgabe umfasste auch die Reichskanzlei und den Führerbunker. Dies veranlasste ihn, die Kampfgruppe Mohnke zu bilden, die sich aus verschiedenen SS-Gruppen zusammensetzte. Ihr Kern waren die legendären 800 Mann der Leibstandarte (LSSAH), des SS-Wachbataillons, der persönlichen Garde Adolf Hitlers.     Diese Gespräche werden aus dem Englischen übersetzt und für die Meisten von uns, sind diese Worte, das erste Mal zu lesen. bzw. zu hören. Hinweis:  Das interessante bebilderte PDF und die Audiodatei sind rechts über "Download Options" zum herunterladen verfügbar!
items.title: Wilhelm Mohnke (General, RK, LSSAH)

James, William 1842-1910 Methodology
description: Introduction. 1. The Center of James's Vision. 2. Between Misinterpretation and Over-literalness. 3. Framing the Larger Project. 4. Critique and Reconstruction -- pt. 1. Overcoming Nihilism and Skepticism. Ch. 1. Beginnings. 1. Between Trail-blazing and Perfectly Ideal Discourse. 2. Reducing the Reductive or Overcoming Nihilism. 3. Theoretic Rationality. 4. Practical Rationality. 5. On Mind Corresponding to Reality. 6. Discerning the Initial Direction of the Trail. Ch. 2. Founding Level of Meaning: Towards an Experiential Grounding of Both Science and Metaphysics. 1. Cracks in the Positivist Model of Science. 2. Clash of Philosophical Goals: Ultimate Comprehension and Ecstatic Union. 3. Overcoming the Split between Science and Metaphysics. 4. Concrete Beginnings: The Fundamental Facts of Knowing-Things-Together, Intentionality, Context, and Temporality -- pt. 2. Interpretive Structures of Human Experience. Ch. 3. Concrete Experience and Selective Interest. 1. A Concrete Methodology. 2. Selective Interest as a Concrete Structure of Experience. 3. Selective Interest as Organizing Principle of The Principles of Psychology. 4. Selective Interest Developed in Other Texts. 5. Radical Finitude

Ch. 4. Concrete Acts of Thinking. 1. Contemplative and Rational Thinking in "Brute and Human Intellect" 2. Extracting the Right Character from the Whole Phenomenon. 3. Critique and Reconstruction of Reasoning in Principles. 4. How Facts Come to Be in "The Importance of Individuals" 5. Conclusion. Ch. 5. Practical and Aesthetic Interests. 1. Postulates Given in Our Nature. 2. The Practical as Coordinate with the Aesthetic. 3. The Practical as Primordial. 4. The Aesthetic. 5. Both Irreducibly Ultimate. Ch. 6. Natural History Methodology and Artistic Vision. 1. Natural History Methodology Transformed. 2. Natural History Findings and Metaphysical Speculation. 3. Re-defining Definitions. 4. Re-describing Description. 5. Observation: "The Primal State of Theoretic and Practical Innocence" 6. Bare Facts in a 'Real' World versus Interpreted Facts of Experienced Phenomena. 7. Creativity. 8. Artistic Vision: "Mystic Sense of Hidden Meaning" -- pt. 3. Hermeneutic Methods. Ch. 7. Interpretive Theory and Praxis. 1. Hermeneutic Structures. 2. A Radically Empiricist Concrete Hermeneutics. 3. Concrete Presuppositions of Hermeneutical Strategy. 4. A Radically Empiricist Hermeneutics of Textual Texts

5. Metaphysical Unification and Hermeneutical Pluralism. 6. Interpretive Structure of The Varieties of Religious Experience. Ch. 8. Analogy and Metaphor. 1. The Genial Play of Association by Similarity. 2. Philosophy: Making Conventionalities Fluid Again. 3. Rationalism and Empiricism. 4. Metaphorical Terminology. 5. The Sculptor's Chisel. Ch. 9. The Scope of Pragmatism. 1. A Method Merely or a Philosophy of Experience? 2. Using the Pragmatic Method to Reconstruct Philosophy. 3. Pragmatic Critique of Reductionist Empiricism and Intellectualist Rationalism. 4. A Doubled Interpretive Space -- pt. 4. Knowledge and Truth. Ch. 10. "Knowing as it Exists Concretely" 1. A Concrete Analysis of the Cognitive Function of Lived Experience. 2. Intentionality in "On the Function of Cognition" 3. The Horizon of Knowing in "On Some Omissions of Introspective Psychology" 4. "A Context Which the World Supplies" 5. Phenomenalist Idealism and Trans-subjective Realism. Ch. 11. Truth. 1. Cognitive Truth and Pragmatic Truth. 2. Criticizing Truth as Correspondence. 3. Truth as Satisfactory Working or Leading. 4. The Practical Character of Our Beliefs. 5. The Concrete Point of View. 6. Truth as Value for Life

7. Objective Truth -- pt. 5. Overcoming the Tradition. Ch. 12. Why Metaphysics? 1. Concrete Analysis of Lived Experience. 2. Is Radical Empiricism a Metaphysics? 3. Incomplete Transformation of the Realist/Metaphysical Perspective into the Concrete/Hermeneutic. Ch. 13. Unexamined Empiricist Assumptions. 1. The Tangle of Science and Metaphysics. 2. Inability to Formalize Structures of Explanation. 3. Reconstructing the Reconstruction. 4. Reconstructing Subjectivity and Objectivity. 5. James's Inability to Produce a Systematic Philosophy. 6. Beyond Metaphysics. Ch. 14. Radical Empiricism as Concrete Alternative to Realism. 1. Dismantling Metaphysics. 2. Pure Experience as Concrete Analysis. 3. A Reconstruction of Realism and Truth from the Perspective of the Full Fact/Full Self. Ch. 15. Critique and Reconstruction of Rationalism. 1. Critique of Rationalism. 2. James's Genealogy of Rationality. 3. Rationality "Taken in its Fullest Sense" 4. Inconclusive Conclusions
items.title: William James's radical reconstruction of philosophy

items.description: Credits to warumono for uploading the original version Windows 3.0 | Under The Spotlight By bringing the graphical interface within the realm of practicality for millions of DOS PCs, Windows 3.0 is certain to have a major impact on the industry’s future. Here’s an in-depth look at the new standard. Since it was introduced some five years ago, Microsoft Windows has been as much an expression of technological evangelism as a practical product. Though it promised to bring the consistency and usability of the graphical user interface to the PC, the limitations of the PC hardware base and the drag of existing standards have held back its progress. So, although Windows has shown a steady growth in popularity that has accelerated rapidly over the past year or so, it has not taken the PC world by storm.

items.description: The Windows 3.0 Test Drive is a demo floppy set that could be obtained for free through PC World. It consists of a stripped down minimal install Windows 3.0 install and a PC World interactive sideshow. There was a separate version for EGA and VGA as well as 1.2mb and 1.44mb disk. Installation instructions Use the VGA version for VGA systems. The EGA version will only install correctly on EGA-only systems.. The Setup program gets confused if you try to install it on a machine with VGA. To install the EGA version on a machine or emulator with VGA, edit the [display] section of the SETUP.INF and add the line: "vga = 1:ega.drv, "EGA", "133,96,72", , 1:egalogo.lgo, , , , 1:egalogo.rle" The included Windows files are crippled to prevent running normal Windows 3.0 software. It is possible to run other Windows 3.0 applications by inserting the string "DEMOAPP" in to an EXE's application description header. But it has Solitaire! So what else do you need? :)
items.title: Windows 3.0 TestDrive (VGA Edition)

items.description: From the Festival Floppies collection. Alien Force is a simple "blast everything that moves" game for Windows 3.xx. It was inspired by fond (albeit vague) memories of an old TRS-80 game called "Attack Force", which I found very addictive. Platform Windows 3.x Released 1990 Perspective Top-down Genre Action, Strategy/Tactics Gameplay Arcade Description Alien Force places you in control of a space ship on a mission to destroy all enemy ships. Destroy every ship on a level and you go up to the next level with more difficult enemies. The action is showed from top-down, and you move around on a one-screen field with obstacles. You are only allowed to shoot one missile at a time, so the game is not about non-stop shooting. In the beginning levels, the enemy ships are easy; not even firing at you. As you progress through the levels, the ships get harder and start to shoot at you. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry

items.description: From the Festival Floppies collection. A simple little falling block type game for windows. Platform Windows 3.x Released Nov, 1990 Gameplay Falling Block Puzzle Pacing Real-Time Genre Puzzle Description Columns is a single player, Falling block puzzle which describes itself as being based on Macintosh Columns by Chris Christensen which, this game claims, was itself based on XColumns by Jay Geertson . The game consists of blocks which themselves consist of three coloured squares. All blocks are the same shape but the coloured squares they contain will vary. The player can position the blocks with the left/right keys, rotate the coloured squares within the block with the up key, and drop the block with the down key. The object is to align the colours so that three or more in a vertical, horizontal, or diagonal line are all of the same colour, when this happens they flash and disappear causing the squares above to drop down. The process repeats until either the player gets bored or the screen fills up. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry

As the pilot of the lander, you must control the vertical and horizontal rockets to guide your craft to a safe landing. All that with limited fuel supplies! From Mobygames.com. Original Entry

items.description: From the Festival Floppies collection. This program is Screen Peace a screen saver for Microsoft Windows 3.xx. "So what?", you say, "I've seen lots of screen savers for Windows." Well... this one is different. Screen Peace by itself is not terribly flashy - it just blanks the screen after a certain number of seconds, but it is extensible. You can add additional screen savers just by putting more screen saver files in the proper directory. If you have the Windows 3.xx SDK and the Screen Peace saver kit,you can make your own screen savers.

items.description: From the Festival Floppies collection. A Oriental Game of Skill and Chance, A game just like Mahjong. Platform Windows 3.x Released 1990 Published by Microsoft Corporation Perspective Top-down Pacing Meditative / Zen Genre Puzzle Gameplay Cards / Tiles, Tile Matching Puzzle Visual Fixed / Flip-screen Description A popular Mahjongg adaptation, Taipei has the player attempting to find matches between the Oriental-motif patterns printed atop "free" (generally: exposed, on corners) tiles in various layered formations. Matched pairs disappear, yielding different free tiles and further matching possibilities. Ostensibly, the game is completed when all tiles are matched, though sometimes random tile placement results in unwinnable games. This game ended up, like many of its brethren, in pretty much every office in the nation courtesy of its inclusion in the Microsoft Entertainment Pack for Windows , and later the Best of Microsoft Entertainment Pack . From Mobygames.com. Original Entry

items.description: From the Festival Floppies collection. This is a Windows v3.xx game of checkers, Very Good. Platform Windows 3.x Released 1990 Pacing Turn-based Genre Strategy/Tactics Gameplay Board Game Perspective Top-down Visual Fixed / Flip-screen Interface Point and Select Description Looking for a game of Checkers? Offering 5 skill levels, it is up to you to capture all your opponents pieces on the game board. You are allowed to move a single space in one direction (up) if no jumps are available. If you are able to jump an opponent's piece, you must do so. Jumping an opponent's piece (or pieces if you can do a multiple jump), captures the piece(s). If you get any of your pieces to the farthest end of the board, you are "kinged". This means that your piece can now move in any direction; offering a distinct advantage. The game allows for 0 to 2 human players. The computer will make up the remaining players to equal 2 players total. You can choose to play as red or black, and can even switch sides. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry

items.description: MISSING COVER Platform Windows 3.x Released 1990 Perspective Top-down Genre Action, Strategy/Tactics Gameplay Arcade Description Alien Force places you in control of a space ship on a mission to destroy all enemy ships. Destroy every ship on a level and you go up to the next level with more difficult enemies. The action is showed from top-down, and you move around on a one-screen field with obstacles. You are only allowed to shoot one missile at a time, so the game is not about non-stop shooting. In the beginning levels, the enemy ships are easy; not even firing at you. As you progress through the levels, the ships get harder and start to shoot at you. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry

items.description: MISSING COVER Platform Windows 3.x Released Nov, 1990 Gameplay Falling Block Puzzle Pacing Real-Time Genre Puzzle Description Columns is a single player, Falling block puzzle which describes itself as being based on Macintosh Columns by Chris Christensen which, this game claims, was itself based on XColumns by Jay Geertson . The game consists of blocks which themselves consist of three coloured squares. All blocks are the same shape but the coloured squares they contain will vary. The player can position the blocks with the left/right keys, rotate the coloured squares within the block with the up key, and drop the block with the down key. The object is to align the colours so that three or more in a vertical, horizontal, or diagonal line are all of the same colour, when this happens they flash and disappear causing the squares above to drop down. The process repeats until either the player gets bored or the screen fills up. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry

items.description: Platform Windows 3.x Released 1990 Perspective Top-down Genre Puzzle Visual Fixed / Flip-screen Description Similar in gameplay to Minesweeper , Mines has you finding all the mines in a minefield. Your goal is to cross the minefield without stepping on any mines. Any space that you have seen will tell you how many mines are surrounding it. Use this to your advantage to determine where the mines are located. Step on a mine and it is all over. The game allows you to choose how many mines there are in the level... from 30 to 160 mines in a 16x16 grid. Unlike in Minesweeper, you cannot just click anywhere on the field to free up a space. Your feet must "walk" around the field as if you were really there; finding mines. Your objective is to walk from the top left corner of the field to the bottom right corner without stepping on any mines. Not all mines have to be found to succeed. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry

items.description: MISSING COVER Released Jun 16, 1991 Also For Atari ST, Linux, Mainframe, Windows Official Site GNU Chess Gameplay Chess Genre Strategy/Tactics Description GNU Chess is a fully functional, freeware, chess program which can play against a human player or another chess program. This program has been around for a long time: Version 1 was written by Stuart Cracraft in 1984 for a Unix system Versions 2, 3, and 4 used Chess by John Stanback at their core Version 5 was written by Chua Kong-Sian The latest version at the time of writing (2014), is version 6.1.2 and this was developed from a chess program called Fruit developed by Fabien Letouzey . This has a new chess engine but is backwards compatible with previous versions GNU Chess version 2.31 was ported to Windows 3.x in 1991 and to WIN 95 in 1995. Versions of GNU Chess v4 series and the v5 series were also ported to Windows but version 6 series does not, in 2014, appear to have a Windows port. The version 2.31 ports have a fully featured graphical interface with the kind of options that are expected of a chess program, there's a hint feature, save/load functions, the ability to change the colours of the board, pieces and text, the board can be setup to play out a set problem etc. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry

subject: Windows 3.0
Microsoft Windows
items.description: Windows 3.0  is the third major release of  Microsoft Windows , launched in 1990. Like its predecessors, it is not an  operating system , but rather a graphical  operating environment  that runs on top of  DOS . It features a new  graphical user interface  (GUI) where  applications  are represented as clickable  icons , as opposed to the list of  file names  seen in its predecessors. Later updates would expand the software's capabilities, one of which added  multimedia  support for sound recording and playback, as well as support for  CD-ROMs . Windows 3.0 is the first version of Windows to perform well both critically and commercially. Critics and users considered its GUI to be a challenger to those of  Apple Macintosh  and  Unix . Other praised features were the improved  multitasking , customizability, and especially the utilitarian management of computer memory that troubled the users of Windows 3.0's predecessors. Microsoft was criticized by third-party developers for the bundling of its separate software with the operating environment, which they viewed as an anticompetitive practice. Windows 3.0 sold 10 million copies before it was succeeded by  Windows 3.1  in 1992

items.description: Windows 3.00 English version + MS-DOS 6.22  Floppy Files  for PC+Virtual Machines NOTE: -Windows 3.00 does not work without MS-DOS Operating System! -Floppy Diskette files are required for Installation. ISO files does not exist! -You can run the Operatiing System by typing  win  on Startup About/Description : Windows 3.0 is a third major release of Microsoft Windows that was released on 22 May 1990 as the successor to Windows 2.x and was the first truly popular version of Windows. It is designed to run on MS-DOS or PC-DOS 3.31 or higher. It was a major improvement over Windows 2.x, featuring a completely revamped user interface. It features a new graphical user interface (GUI) where applications are represented as clickable icons, as opposed to the list of file names seen in its predecessors. Later updates would expand the software's capabilities, one of which added multimedia support for sound recording and playback, as well as support for CD-ROMs. Windows 3.0 can run in up to 24-bit color mode, given the proper display driver and graphics card. It was the last version to support 8088/8086 real mode (640k RAM) as Windows 3.1 only offered "Standard mode" (max 16MB RAM on 80286) and "386 Enhanced mode" (on 80386). Regardless of which mode is chosen, Windows 3.0 cannot recognize more than 16 MB of RAM. Officially supported by Microsoft until December 31, 2001. Windows 3.0 sold 10 million copies. Minimum PC System Requirements: Architecture : x86 16-bit, CPU : 8086 , 8088 prosessor 10 mhz or better, RAM : 1 MB or 2 MB, Display (Video) : an EGA, MCGA or VGA adapters or better, Auxiliary OS : MS-DOS or PC-DOS 3.1 or higher, Hard Drive : Hard drive with 6–8 MB of free space, Floppy: at least one floppy drive for the installation disks. ======================================================== MS-DOS 6.22 Eng with CD-ROM (for PC & Virtual Machine) File: MS-DOS 6.22 Eng with CD-ROM Support.rar MD5: 33139590702377297909f6b5daab621b SHA-1: 1a75feb9a0ac4514469c5782286f550310de7194 Size: 3,54 MB (3 717 338 bytes) DOWNLOAD - ARCHIVE ORG ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Windows 3.00 Eng Floppy Disks (WinWorldPC) File: Microsoft Windows 3.0 English (3.5 720K).7z MD5: afa18f76b0f41eb5879487634de2e4e2 SHA-1: 4b5c80f75ea8d30aa134f7eb3b0b495050ed323d Size: 3,75 MB (3 936 086 bytes) KEY: no key needed! items.description: Winds of Change: A Matter of Choice Hosted by Hattie Kauffman (PBS Home Video, 1990) Running Time: 1 Hour Winds of Change: A Matter of Choice To remain on the reservation or move out into the broader fabric of society is the choice faced by young American Indians today. “Winds of Change: A Matter of Choice” is about such choices and about some of the people who have made them. In Milwaukee, the Ignaces enjoy a mainstream upper class life style, acknowledging the loss of some Indian traditions, while Del Porter has found an extended family in neighborhood gathering places. Porter’s daughter travels between the city and the reservation trying to strike a balance in her identity as an individual and as an Indian. At a Hopi reservation, Pat Ross and her family have returned to meet resistance in rejoining the clan. With choices come trade-offs. As Indians nations work to accommodate change and offer new opportunities from within, some stay, others still leave. For all of them, the ties to Indian life, while not easily undone, are being challenged by the future. Hattie Kauffman, national correspondent for CBS THIS MORNING, is the host of “Winds of Change: A Matter of Choice,” the second in a two-part series produced by Wisconsin Public Television. Kauffman, a winner of four Emmy Awards, was a special correspondent for ABC’s GOOD MORNING AMERICA and a substitute for host Joan Lunden before joining CBS in March 1990. Born on a reservation in Idaho, Kauffman is half Nez Perce and half German. PBS 319 • Color • 60 Minutes ©1990 Wisconsin Educational Communications Board and Board of Regents UW System. items.description: Winds of Change: A Matter of Promises Hosted by N. Scott Momaday (PBS Home Video, 1990) Running Time: 1 Hour Winds of Change: A Matter of Promises This is the rarely told story of nations within a nation, of the sovereign Indian tribes that survive in America today. “Like a rock that a river runs around,” is how one Indian describes his nation in the stream of U.S. life. “Winds of Change: A Matter of Promises” draws us into the lives of these Native Americans today, and the challenges they face as they try to preserve their cultures. It is a story of promises kept and treaties broken, seen through the eyes of three distinct tribes. Hosted by Pulitzer Prize-winning author N. Scott Momaday, “A Matter of Promises” takes us first to the nation of the Onondaga people of New York State. We see a land of great beauty, where buffalo still roam and people carry a passport recognized around the world. We also see how they strive to preserve their clan among young people, and what happens when youth leave the reservation for schools and jobs. In a society traced through women, where no child is ever illegitimate, a noble way of life endures. “A Matter of Promises” also travels to Arizona, to the legendary Navajo nation. A place the size of Ireland, of vast skies and huge vistas, this is a land with no private ownership, no addresses. We see instead how they pursue a tradition of peacemaking, with a judicial system that ranges from a police force to a superior court. Intent on preserving their complex language and culture, the Navajo reveal a deep wisdom, which fosters their identity as a unique people. Equally distinct is the Lummi nation of Washington state, an island people who have come to symbolize the Indian struggle for self-determination. “Winds of Change: A Matter of Promises” traces their fight to retain their ancient fishing rights: a fight for sovereignty they have taken seven times to the U.S. Supreme Court. We get an intimate look at how they use the traditional ‘talking circle’ to achieve coop-eration, and how they preserve the balance of nature in the waters around them.  “Winds of Change: A Matter of Promises” carries the viewer to many diverse settings, on a journey fueled by the spirit of hope. The ties of Indian nationhood may be strained by the pressures of modern U.S. life, but the nobility of this struggle is an inspiration. As one Indian observed: “Humankind has not woven the web of life. We are but a thread of it.” PBS 262 • Color • 60 Minutes ©1990 Wisconsin Educational Communications Board and Board of Regents UW System. All rights reserved. description: During the past eight decades French vineyards, wineries, and wine marketing efforts have undergone such profound changes--from technological, scientific, economic, and commercial standpoints--that the transformation is revolutionary for an industry dating back thousands of years. Here Leo Loubre examines how the modernization of Western society has brought about new conditions in well-established markets, making the introduction of novel techniques and processes a matter of survival for winegrowers. Not only does Loubre explain how altered environmental conditions have enabled pioneering enologists to create styles of wine more suited to contemporary tastes and living arrangements, but he also discusses the social impact of the wine revolution on the employees in the industry. The third generation of this new viticultural regime has encountered working and living conditions drastically different from those of its predecessors, while witnessing the near disappearance of the working class and the decline of small and medium growers of ordinary wines. Originally published in 1990. subject: Wing Commander
Chris Roberts
Origin Systems
MS-DOS
items.description: Wing Commander is the eponymous first game in Chris Roberts' science fiction space flight simulation franchise Wing Commander by Origin Systems. The game was first released for MS-DOS on September 26, 1990 and was later ported to the Amiga, CD32 (256-color), Sega CD and the Super Nintendo Entertainment System, and re-released for the PC as Wing Commander I in 1994. An enhanced remake Super Wing Commander was made for the 3DO in 1994, later ported to the Macintosh. The game was a marked departure from the standard formula, bringing space combat to a level approaching the Star Wars films. Set in the year 2654 and characterized by Chris Roberts as "World War II in space", it features a multinational cast of pilots from the "Terran Confederation" flying missions against the predatory, aggressive Kilrathi, a feline warrior race (heavily inspired by the Kzinti of Larry Niven's Known Space universe).
items.title: Wing Commander

subject: shrimper
winky dog
items.description: Winky Dog is a 1990 Various Artists compilation released as a cassette on Shrimper (SHR01). It is primarily a compilation of experimental music.   The release was distributed by K. The cover described the release as follows: Pop, industrial, punk and real neato things for only $2.00*, the price of one lonely golfball. Side A is tracks 01-07. Side B is tracks 08-13. Tracklist: 01 Buzzsaw - Die Rote Luft 02 The Bux - Dumb Holiday 03 Satnam Puppets - 2 04 Nothing Painted Blue - Caprice Cadillac 05 Paste - Exercise 21 06 Shoeface - Rollin' In the Dough 07 Wckr Spgt - A Thousand Hail Mary's 08 Franklin Bruno - Clean Needle 09 Welfare - Welfare 10 Halo - Around + Around 11 Girlhole - Real Song 12 Fip Placard - Song for Farah 13 Jim Bishop - Part of, Not All of 2 Buzzsaw's exact line-up is unknown to me. If you have any information, please reach out. The Bux is Dennis Callaci and his brother Allen Callaci. Satnam Puppets' exact line-up is unknown to me. If you have any information, please reach out. Nothing Painted Blue is Franklin Bruno, Kyle Brodie and (most likely) Michael Neelon. Paste is Dennis Callaci. Shoeface is Bob Durkee, Nathan Wilson and Mark Hower. Wckr Spgt is Joel Huschle, Mark Givens and Dave Carpenter. Welfare is Nathan Wilson and (possibly) Mike Masatsugu. Halo is Ian Smith and Scott Feemstar. Girlhole's exact line-up is unknown to me. If you have any information, please reach out. Fip Placard's exact line-up is unknown to me, though I am aware that it included Rick Bunce. If you have any more information, please reach out. Jim Bishop is Nathan Wilson and Tom Duda. This is not my music. All rights go to the artists featured and the label Shrimper (founder Dennis Callaci). If you are a copyright owner for this release, please contact me at blazingjetblack@gmail.com with any concerns, and I will be happy to oblige all requests.
items.title: Various Artists - Winky Dog (1990)

This particular video is actually quite interesting as it's a post-New Adventures of Winnie the Pooh product to feature some talent from Welcome to Pooh Corner. Mainly Laurie Main who's  the narrator (just like in WTPC) and Phil Baron (Song write and VA for Piglet in WTPC) who helped co-write the program with Michelle Baron (not sure if there's any relations here) as well as doing the music/theme song. Definitely quite an interesting piece of Pooh history I wanted to get up on here. Might end up reripping it in the future  along with Back to School as well as maybe reuploading it onto YouTube. Though, I hope you folks enjoy this for the time being.

items.subject: Athletics
description: In this book the authors examine the marginal factors that so often separate success and failure in the world of sport. They show how the modern sportsperson can learn to incorporate important new methods into standard training programmes in an effort to achieve extra performance. They demonstrate how a natural approach to conditioning both the mind and body can help athletes realize potential without recourse to damaging and illegal drugs. Based largely upon their own experiences, the authors re-examine some well established techniques such as mental imagery and weight training, as well as explore more modern concepts including the uses of hydro-therapy and massage. From the basics of dietary regime and choice of footwear, to the authors' advanced ideas on the value of stretching exercises, the aim is simple - to give the athlete that all-important competitive edge
items.title: Winning without drugs : the natural approach to competitive sport

items.description: The Harpeth Hall School is an independent college preparatory school for young women in grades 5-12 in Nashville, TN. Begun in 1973, Winterim is a three-week program of on-and off-campus opportunities meant to broaden the intellectual horizons of our high school students. Unique course offerings, internships, educational travel and international exchanges offer students the very best in experiential learning, creating for them a chance to see their academic studies take a tangible, dynamic form. Taking place every January, Winterim is a signature program within Harpeth Hall’s innovative curriculum. The 1993 catalog is divided into two halves: Freshman/Sophmore and Junior/Senior.

description: "This groundbreaking collection brings together 28 stunning stories by literary talents never before assembled in a single volume. With contributions from both established and bright new voices in lesbian fiction, 'Women on Women' ranges from the subtlety and restraint of Willa Cather's 'Tommy, the Unsentimental' to Sapphire's daring and highly erotic 'Eat' and Valerie Miner's suspenseful 'Trespassing.' Some of the stories are universal in theme - the joy and excitement of new romance, the ageless problems of family life, and the pain of lost love and of death. And many are written by or about members of racial, ethnic, and other minorities within the gay community. These are stories that offer stirring, eloquent, often passionate insights into the lesbian experience in a long-overdue collection that represents the best of lesbian short fiction from past to present"--Amazon.com
items.title: Women on women : an anthology of American lesbian short fiction

subject: United States. Army. Women's Army Corps
USA
Geschichte (1945-1978)
description: The Women's Army Corps, 1942-1945 -- Women in the postwar Army -- WAC organization and training -- The Korean War era -- Officer procurement and career development -- Strength goals and the move to Fort McClellan -- Management and image -- The 1960s : a new look -- Vietnam : WAC strength : WAC standards -- The end of the draft and WAC expansion -- The women's rights movement and the WAC -- WAC Center and WAC School -- Women in the Army -- Conclusions -- Appendix A: Personnel statistics -- Appendix B: MOSs and training -- Appendix C: Key personnel -- Appendix D: Women's Army Corps uniforms, 1942-1978

The Women's Army Corps makes a significant contribution to women's history and the history of the Army. Bettie J. Morden weaves the ideas and moral attitudes that existed in the middle decades of the twentieth century to chronicle thirty-three years of WAC history from V-J Day 1945 to 20 October 1978, when the Women's Army Corps was abolished by Public Law 95-584 and discontinued by Department of the Army General Order 20, with the WAC officers assimilated into the other branches of the Army (except the combat arms). For the most part taking a chronological approach, Morden focuses on the interaction of plans, decisions, and personalities that affected the WAC directors as they pushed and prodded the Army, the Department of Defense, and Congress to achieve Regular Army and Reserve status, military credit for Women's Army Auxiliary Corps service, and promotion above the grade of lieutenant colonel. The early WAC directors, according to Morden, had the task of fighting for progress and equity, whereas their successors fought a losing battle to keep entry standards high and to retain the corps' separate status. She provides readers with a comprehensive picture of WAC growth and development and the transformation in the status of Army women brought by the advent of the all-volunteer Army and the women's rights movement of the seventies
Society for Military History Distinguished Book Award, 1991
items.title: The Women's Army Corps, 1945-1978

description: pt. 1. Interconnections between formal and informal work. Linking women's labor with the global economy : factory workers and their families in rural Java / Diane L. Wolf -- Disguised industrial proletarians in rural Latin America : women's informal-sector factory work and the social reproduction of coffee farm labor in Colombia / Cynthia Truelove -- Façon : women's formal and informal work in the garment industry in Kavala, Greece / Joanna Hadjicostandi -- pt. 2. The role of the state. Export-led development and the underemployment of women : the impact of discriminatory development policy in the Republic of Ireland / Jean L. Pyle -- Women's work and women's place in the Japanese economic miracle / Larry S. Carney and Charlotte G. O'Kelly -- pt. 3. Resistance and ambivalence. "Their logic against them" : contradictions in sex, race, and class in Silicon Valley / Karen J. Hossfeld -- Women and the export industry in Taiwan : the muting of class consciousness / Rita S. Gallin -- Maquiladora women : a new category of workers? / Susan Tiano

Since economists traditionally focus on market activities, women's non-wage labour has not been registered in works on economic development. On the other hand, women's wage labour has been described as supplementary or marginal to the household income as well as to economic development as a whole. The contributors to this collection did their research on women workers in countries from the core, the semiperiphery, and the periphery. The eight articles are introduced by Kathryn Ward, who presents a critical overview of the literature on women workers and globalization. In Ward's opinion we have to develop new definitions for some key concepts in our theories on women and work. These concepts should aim at including housework and work in the informal sector, and women's various acts of resistance. Ward also suggests new perspectives from which we should theorize about women's work in the process of global restructuring
items.title: Women workers and global restructuring

subject: DOS
MS DOS
Alice in Wonderland
items.description: Alice was sitting at the river bank with her sister and got drowsy. Suddenly, she sees a white rabbit who was hurrying somewhere, muttering something to himself. Curious, Alice follows the rabbit into a hole that leads into a bizarre world populated by strange and exotic creatures. Alice has to use her wits in order to understand Wonderland's twisted laws of logic and figure out a way to return home. Wonderland  is a text adventure with graphics, based on Lewis Carroll's classic novel  Alice in Wonderland . The game follows the book's general story while adding many descriptions, locations, and puzzles of its own. The interaction with the environment is done mostly by typing; however, commands may also appear in pop-up menus and can be selected by the player. Sometimes puzzles need to be solved in order to be able to advance. The game features windows with adjustable size, separating the graphical display from inventory, command interface, text descriptions, and other options. From Mobygames.com.  Original Entry

items.subject: Evolution
items.description: The principal aspects and events in the evolution of insects, and the nature of their fossil record are reviewed. A Palaeozoic fauna of extinct orders and suborders, diverse in size, habitat, habit, and diet, was progressively replaced in the Permian by the stem-groups and early representatives of extant orders. The distribution in time of the Palaeozoic orders, and the first appearances of superfamilies of most of the remaining orders, are figured and discussed. There is no very strong evidence for explosive supraordinal radiations following significant evolutionary events, and the first appearances of important groups are not always immediately followed by major diversification. Within orders rapid expansions can be recognized following the presumed appearance of new type of larva, and particularly in association with the rise of the angiosperms, which provided the impetus for massive radiations at several trophic levels.
items.title: Major insect radiations

items.subject: Quotations, English
description: Collected in this book are mankind's thoughts and feelings from the earliest times to the most recent past. This collection includes more than 2,500 quotes from the social sciences to the natural sciences, from poetry to philosophy, from theism to agnosticism, and from rationalism to mysticism. Scrupulously researched by the author, an historian well acquainted with all cultures and civilizations, this collection is unparalleled for its superior collection of quotations. Contrasting and complementary ideas are presented from such philosophers and pundits as Oscar Wilde, Thomas Jefferson, Sophocles, and Margaret Mead
Originally published as: What a piece of work is man : Camp's unfamiliar quotations from 2000 B.C. to the present, 1989, ©1990

items.description: Get the edge in school or business with this precisely done              vocabulary enhancement tool!   You know that people judge you            by the clothes you wear, but did you realize that they too               judge you by your vocabulary?  Well, now's the time to use this          smartly designed software to increase your working vocabulary            to further your career in the business world or school!                  This well designed package allows you to test yourself by                having presented either the word itself or the word definition           itself in the quiz format.  You can use the author's initial             100 word starter vocabulary set to familiarize yourself with             the software and with registration, you'll receive the 500               word vocabulary file.  You can create your own specialized               vocabulary files for specific learning tasks, whether it be              a foreign language or a specialized interest area, such as               computers!  Within the program itself, you can also define the           screen colors most appealing to you.  The program is bug free,           fast, and elegant in its simplicity; a must for students. The QUIZ Program is an interactive, multiple choice  test   to   help   you   learn   vocabulary   words  and  definitions quickly. QUIZ   works   with   WORDS   databases.  The 500 word  database you received along with this program   will  provide   hours   of education and entertainment when  used in conjunction with QUIZ. QUIZ   will choose, from the database you specify, a  word at random.   It will display it for you,   along  with four definitions, also from the database. Only  one   of   the   four is correct.   You must choose the  correct definition, the   one   that   best   fits   the  meaning   of   the   word.   Alternately,   you can have  QUIZ show you a   definition   and   four   words   from  which to choose. QUIZ will keep this up as long as you like, all the  while  keeping track of the number of words you get  correct and wrong. QUIZ can greatly increase the speed   at   which   you  learn   vocabulary.    It makes the learning more fun  as well.
items.title: Words 1.2

subject: rare film
music film
documentary
experimental film
Brian Eno
John Cale
Falklands Suite
Dylan Thomas
items.description: "The creative process is a mysterious labyrinth often as puzzling to the artist as to the layman observing it. This fact does nothing to dim the curiosity of those intent on finding a key to unlock the hidden meanings in the conversation between creator and muse. As is well-known, the observation of something usually changes the thing being observed. Still the desire to know the unknowable persists. This is the dilemma at the heart of WORDS FOR THE DYING, the 1990 documentary on John Cale and Brian Eno, directed by Rob Nilsson. The film follows Cale and Eno (and Nilsson, who shows you his camera and sound equipment, making no attempt to delude viewers into thinking they're observing "reality") as they travel through Moscow, London, Wales and Amsterdam in preparation for the recording of "The Falklands Suite," the work at the core of Cale's 1989 album Words for the Dying. WORDS FOR THE DYING shows the artists and filmmaker as the struggle to come to some understanding of the creative process. It doesn't sugarcoat matters as is evident from the first shot in which Eno, smirking cynically, goes on at length about his reluctance to take part in the film, while Cale laughs nervously and Nilsson does a headstand. The clash of egos is set up and continues to unfold for the rest of the film. (Despite his alleged decision to opt out, there is a shot of Eno in the control booth wearing a wireless mic that makes it possible for the filmmaker to capture all his comments, even the snide asides, so one wonders how unwilling he actually was)." -j. poet
items.title: Words for the Dying (1990)

items.description: Working Girl (1990) Sandra Bullock -sitcom - all 8 eps     American sitcom adapted from the 1988 film Created by Kimberly Hill, Tom Patchett.  With Sandra Bullock, George Newbern, Anthony Tyler Quinn, Judy Prescott.    This situation comedy based on the popular film featured more of the adventures of secretary Tess McGill in the office setting.     SOURCE -  Youtuber Andrew Millsap -    Working Girl (Season 1)   playlist Youtuber Vintage TV And Collectables Youtuber Laugh Track    Working Girl is an American sitcom that aired on NBC from April to July 1990. Loosely based on the 1988 film of the same name starring Melanie Griffith, the series stars Sandra Bullock as Tess McGill, in a role that was initially meant for Nancy McKeon.   --   The non-profit streaming of the commercial free, quality films I have very much enjoyed and therefore uploaded to archive.org, are for educational purposes. I have uploaded each movie for posterity, with the hope that all present and future generations will learn from and enjoy them, as much as I have. I own zero rights to this film, nor to any other I have uploaded, and I receive nothing (no $) for the uploads nor for the information I put with those uploads. Although I do receive great joy from sharing these uploads with you, I have no wish to infringe on any existing copyright laws.

description: Based primarily on ethnographic data, "Working Class without Work" examines the identity formation process among white working-class youth in the context of the de-industrialization of the American economy. The elimination of many basic production jobs and the expansion of the service sector have changed the expectations and opportunities of the white working class. Weis documents the way in which these young people respond to such changes, and the way they help to create the conditions of their future lives. items.description: With the ever changing environment of Navy stock points, the Navy Supply Systems Command saw the need to design and develop a course in Stock Point Operations for mid-grade managers. This thesis is a part of that effort. The focus of the thesis research was the design and development of eight hours of course material on work-load planning to be included as a finishing section of the 40-hour Stock Point Operations course. Included in this thesis are a history of the need for the course development and the management methodologies incorporated in the course material. Chapter IV provides the framework for mid- grade managers to standardize the formulation of the most effective and efficient work-load plan for their own organizations.
items.title: Work-load planning for Navy stock points

description: In 1990, New City Press, in conjunction with the Augustinian Heritage Institute, began the project knows as: The Works of Saint Augustine, A Translation for the 21st Century. The plan is to translate and publish all 132 works of Saint Augustine, his entire corpus into modern English. This represents the first time in which The Works of Saint Augustine will all be translated into English. Many existing translations were often archaic or faulty, and the scholarship was outdated. New City Press is proud to offer the best modern translations available. The Works of Saint Augustine, A Translation for the 21st Century will be translated into 49 published books. To date, 41 books have been published by NCP containing 93 of The Works of Saint Augustine, A Translation for the 21st Century. Augustine's writings are useful to anyone interested in patristics, church history, theology and Western civilization. -- Publisher

description: pt. 1, v. 1. The confessions -- pt. 1, v. 5. The Trinity -- pt. 1, v. 9. description: In 1990, New City Press, in conjunction with the Augustinian Heritage Institute, began the project knows as: The Works of Saint Augustine, A Translation for the 21st Century. The plan is to translate and publish all 132 works of Saint Augustine, his entire corpus into modern English. This represents the first time in which The Works of Saint Augustine will all be translated into English. Many existing translations were often archaic or faulty, and the scholarship was outdated. New City Press is proud to offer the best modern translations available. The Works of Saint Augustine, A Translation for the 21st Century will be translated into 49 published books. To date, 41 books have been published by NCP containing 93 of The Works of Saint Augustine, A Translation for the 21st Century. Augustine's writings are useful to anyone interested in patristics, church history, theology and Western civilization. -- Publisher

Bloomington Indiana radio
items.description: On the night John Lennon was killed, WQAX -- Bloomington, Indiana's campus/community cable FM radio station -- had already shut down for the night. For the next 13 years, veteran DJ Melanthe Alexian took the overnight of December 8/9 to play John and Yoko's music and sound collage, Beatles music and novelties, interviews and parodies. Beginning in 1990, per Yoko Ono's request that fans celebrate John's life, the program went to October 9, John's birthday. These promo posters, designed by Alexian and WQAX founder and general manager Jim Berkey, went up all over the city of Bloomington.
items.title: WQAX Poster Last Dec. 8 John Lennon Special Complete

items.subject: Amiga CDTV
items.description: Side-scrolling action game for the Amiga CDTV. Developed by Abstrax Released 1991 Also For Amiga, Atari ST, Commodore 64, DOS Published by ReadySoft Incorporated Perspective Side view Setting Fantasy Genre Action Gameplay Arcade, Platform Visual 2D scrolling Description The mighty wizard Anthrax, in an attempt to usurp authority over the kingdom, has summoned a horrifying Demon. The Demon makes good on his chartered task by summoning a horde of monsters to lay waste to the kingdom at large. Fortuitously, a random stranger is strolling nearby the kingdom and realizes that only he can beat back the foul creatures. After some encouragement from the king, the adventurer begins the game on horseback, jumping over obstacles, beating flying creatures, and collecting potions on the ground. Afterward, the hero must proceed on foot through side-scrolling platforming levels, destroying creatures with his blade as well as collecting potions and additional weapons he will find on his deadly quest. From Mobygames.com. Original Entry
items.title: Wrath of the Demon

subject: Word Whiz
Apogee
Word Games
items.description: Word Whiz is one of the earliest releases from Apogee Software, created by Scott Miller himself. Similar to  Trivia Whiz , Word Whiz is a textmode quiz game where you are presented with a sentence, and are asked to choose the correct definition of a highlighted word within the sentence. More people are likely to be able to enjoy this game than Trivia Whiz, since this one tests your vocabulary rather than esoteric (and often US-centric) trivia knowledge. This full version of the previously shareware-licensed game was released for free by Apogee in 2005. All four games are basically the same except with different sets of questions.
items.title: Word Whiz

subject: WWF
Survivor Series
items.description: WWF Survivor Series 1990 con los comentarios de Héctor del Mar y José Luis Ibáñez. Primera mitad del show emitido en España. Evento absolutamente histórico donde podemos ver el debut de The Undertaker (El Enterrador) narrado por nuestros queridos comentaristas de la era Telecinco. Hay que remarcar que el PPV emitido en España estuvo dividido en dos programas, y desgraciadamente solo tenemos uno de ellos. Por suerte, es la parte más importante, donde tuvo lugar el inicio de la carrera de uno de los luchadores más importantes de WWF. Y aprovechamos para recordaros que si tenéis algún programa semanal, PPV o fragmento de lucha libre en castellano, podéis enviárnoslo para que lo publiquemos en la Videoteca. ¡Que lo disfrutéis! Este canal no monetiza los vídeos y fue creado con la única intención de preservar y agrupar el contenido de WWE en castellano. Si tienes un evento o fragmento de WWE en castellano, no te olvides de enviárnoslo y lo subiremos al canal. Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/@outcastsdelwrestling  Twitter: https://twitter.com/OutcastsDelPW Telegram: https://t.me/VideotecaODW iVoox: https://go.ivoox.com/sq/1589761  Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/show/1F9xoMvHokUJlCRVyzhsw0?si=ec1d006962bf4a13

subject: veteran
World War II
WWII
POW
prisoner of war
oral history
buffalo
SUNY Buffalo State
items.description: In honor of Veteran’s Day, the Archives & Special Collections has digitized a series of WWII POW interviews conducted in 1990 by Mark Rieman as part of a Master’s Thesis in History. The collection includes eight interviews with veterans spanning 1-2 hours each and discusses their enlistment, boot camp, wartime experiences, capture, treatment, liberation, and reflections on their time serving in the military. To a person, they embodied the spirit of patriotism, honor, and commitment to preserving the freedoms of a country they loved. We are honored to host this collection and thank Mark Rieman and all of the veterans who agreed to be interviewed for their willingness to commit their experiences to history.  Interviewees include:  Ray Buerster Joseph Frage Thomas Lyons Robert McPherson Donald Meckle Walter Niespodziewany Henry Pacer Gordon Tucker The full collection be accessed at: https://digitalcommons.buffalostate.edu/wwii_pow/
items.title: WWII POW Interviews by Mark Rieman

items.description: Two brochures/datasheets for Wyse Technologies WY-997 8-port serial board and WY-999 Serial Port Concentrator. These devices were used with late 1980s and early 1990s Xenix and Unix computer systems to add many serial communications ports.  These ports could then be used to connect serial terminals (display plus keyboards for interactive use), printers or other serial peripherals. This technology is mostly replaced by the use of Ethernet network connections to connect peripherals and client workstations to large computers as well as Universal Serial Bus to connect peripherals directly to computers.
items.title: Wyse WY-997 WY-999 Serial Communications Hardware product brochures

subject: Mystery fiction

England
English fiction
description: A dubious cul-de-sac just off the busy main road in a sprawling West Country port, Stanley Street is definitely not a salubrious place. And the victim, found naked and strangled in her bed is, appropriately enough, a prostitute. The local inspector believes it is just another sex crime, but Chief Superintendent Wycliffe is not convinced. For the victim, Lily Painter, is the kind of girl who likes Beethoven and has lots of 'O' and 'A' levels to her name - not the usual sort of prostitute at all. And when Wycliffe goes digging into her background, he comes up with plenty of surprises, not least a shadowy connection with property speculators and drug smugglers. But it takes a dangerous arson attack and a second murder before the solution to this complex and fast-moving puzzle can be found ..
items.title: Wycliffe and death in Stanley Street

items.description: Warren Zevon  1990-02-17 Newport Music Hall Columbus, OH Aiwa CM-30A Stereo Microphone Sony WM-D3 Walkman Professional Stereo Cassette-Corder Maxell MX90, No Noise Reduction; Sound Forge 9.0 Capture to Wave, Volume Boost and Fades; CD Wave 1.98 Track Splitting on Sector Boundaries; Trader's Little Helper 2.4.0 Encode .wav to .flac & create .md5 Checksum File [01:36:10] 01. Buster Douglas tribute 02. Even A Dog Can Shake Hands 03. Poor, Poor Pitiful Me 04. Boom Boom Mancini 05. I'll Sleep When I'm Dead 06. Roland The Headless Thompson Gunner 07. Sentimental Hygiene 08. Splendid Isolation 09. Detox Mansion 10. Reconsider Me 11. A Certain Girl 12. band intro 13. Transverse City 14. Run Straight Down 15. The Long Arm of the Law 16. Turbulence 17. Werewolves of London 18. band intro 19. Play It All Night Long 20. Lawyers, Guns and Money 21. Mohammed's Radio Band: Warren Zevon - Vocals, Piano Frank Simes - Guitar Jennifer Condos - Bass Ian Wallace - Drums Those familiar with Warren know that he had an obsession with boxing. Six days prior to this show, Buster Douglas, a Columbus native, knocked out the undisputed heavyweight champion, Mike Tyson, to earn the title. In an apparent nod of approval, Warren opened the show with an add-libbed tribute to Buster. The proud hometown crowd went wild, which set the tone for this awesome evening of rock and roll entertainment.

items.description: Catálogo de la muestra del X Salón Arturo y Rebeca Rabinovich, celebrado en 1990, en el que resultó ganador con el Primer Premio el artista Alejandro Castaño, estudiante de la Universidad Nacional del Colombia sede Medellín, con sus obras “¿Por qué no Rueda la Rueda en ¿America? y “¿A dónde fueron?” (concreto y laminilla de oro). Reciben menciones el artista Henry Manuel Fandiño, estudiante de la Universidad Nacional de Colombia; y la artista María Dolores Garcés, estudiante de la Universidad de Antioquia. A partir de esta versión del Salón se le suma el nombre de la señora Rebeca, como un homenaje a la abuela de uno de los miembros de la familia que apoyan el premio en sus 20 versiones.
items.title: X Salón Arturo y Rebeca Rabinovich 1990

subject: midi, orchestrator, daw
x-orv
items.description: Dr. T's X-oR Universal System Exclusive Orchestrator software combines patch creation and editing with librarian and database functions for many popular MIDI devices. Te program is designed to provide a single transparent means of controlling all the MIDI devices in a setup using the System Exclusive codes for each device to operate it independently. Under the program's control an asortment of MIDI gear from a variety of manufacturers behaves as a single instrument with various views. This version works in Standard and Enhanced mode, and is compatible with Windows 3.1. X-oR now supports the MPU401 driver provided by Microsoft Corp. as part of the Multimedia Extensions (and Windows 3.1). Make sure that the MPU401 driver is properly installed in the Drivers section of Control Panel. All references to MIDIDRV or any other type of driver in the manual is obsolete. By default, X-oR will attempt to use MIDI In Device 0 and MIDI Out Device 0. These assignments can be changed using the "MIDI Devices" menu item (in the Get/Send menu). This dialog also allows to set specific Sysex buffer lengths and number of buffers. The default is 5 buffers of 1024 bytes. Any number of buffers of any length can be used, provided the total space is less than 64K. Sysex buffers do not have to be long enough for the maximum possible message! The default setting "should" be OK except for instruments like the CZ-101, which does not converse with the host in complete sysex messages. For such a synth, use a sysex buffer size of 1 bytes, and use 500 buffers. The MIDI settings you select will be written to WIN.INI under the [Midiapi] section. After installing X-or to your hard drive, you have to copy the profiles from the X-oR Profiles disks to the directory X-oR resides in. Most profiles also have a coresponding help file (.HLP) 1- Log on to the X-oR directory type: C:<enter>   CD\XOR<enter> (where C: is the drive letter where X-or is installed) 2- copy the desired profile from the profile disk type: COPY A:\MANUFACTURER\PROFILE.* (where MANUFACTURER is the name of the device's manufacturer, and PROFILE is the name of the X-oR profile) ie: to copy the Roland D50 profile type: COPY A:\ROLAND\D50.* You may have to get a directory listing of the Profile disk to see the names of the manufacturer directories and profiles.

sub español
items.description: Gohan  and  Oolong  search for the  magical  Dragon Balls and their  radar  shows them that the orbs are being gathered by another, unknown party. They investigate near a large wall of ice where  Piccolo  is training. Meanwhile, the  mad scientist  Dr. Kochin, having successfully gathered all of the Dragon Balls, summons the eternal dragon Shenron and  wishes  for Dr. Wheelo and his lab to be released from the ice. The ice breaks away as a building emerges and Gohan and Oolong are attacked by Dr. Kochin's "bio-men". Piccolo saves them but is overcome by three mysterious warriors while Gohan and Oolong escape. Dr. Kochin and his bio-men soon present themselves to  Master Roshi  who refuses to accompany them to Wheelo's lab and defeats the bio-men. Dr. Kochin kidnaps  Bulma  to force Master Roshi to pursue them. At Wheelo's lab, Master Roshi is forced to fight three "bio-warriors" but is swiftly defeated. Bulma discovers that Dr. Wheelo's mission is to obtain the body of the strongest warrior on Earth to become the host for his brain, which is currently separated from his deceased body and kept alive by his advanced technology. Bulma informs him that  Goku  will undoubtedly be coming to rescue them and that he is much more powerful than Roshi. Meanwhile, Goku learns of situation and he arrives at Dr. Wheelo's lab and is confronted by Mikokatsun, Kishime, and Ebifurya – Dr. Kochin's three bio-warrior  henchmen . Goku defeats Mikokatsun but is frozen by an ice-like attack launched by Ebifurya. Gohan and  Krillin  arrive to help but are no match for Kishime. Goku breaks free from ice with his Kaio-ken technique, defeats the two remaining bio-warriors, and confronts Dr. Wheelo. Piccolo, who has been brainwashed by Dr. Wheelo, attacks Goku. Gohan tries to stop Piccolo but fails, causing his anger to explode, shattering Dr. Wheelo's brainwashing device. Dr. Wheelo is stunned by Gohan's power and desires to steal his body instead. He breaks his  robot  body free from the ice wall, subsequently knocking Dr. Kochin down a shaft which kills him. Dr. Wheelo attacks, overwhelms the fighters, and only Goku and Piccolo are left to oppose him. Goku knocks Dr. Wheelo into the atmosphere and begins to form a Spirit Bomb attack. Wheelo interrupts him before he can finish gathering the  energy  for it requiring Goku's allies to distract Wheelo. Goku's successfully launches the bomb and Wheelo is killed.

subject: История
17 век
items.description: Забелин Иван Егорович (1820-1908) Домашний быт русских царей в XVI и XVII столетии : Книга 1 : Государев двор, или дворец  Место издания: Москва Издательство: Книга Год издания: 1990 Количество страниц: 418 с. Тираж:  ISBN 5-212-00541-8 Книга открывает переиздание фундаментального труда «Домашний быт русских царей в XVI я XVII ст.», созданного выдающимся русским историком Иваном Егоровичем Забелиным (1820—1908). Читатель познакомится с историей возникновения, постройки и перестроек государева дворца, узнает о внешнем виде и внутреннем убранстве древних хором, о всем дворцовом великолепии. Для всех, интересующихся русской историей.
items.title: Домашний быт русских царей в XVI и XVII столетии : Книга 1 : Государев двор, или дворец (1990)

items.subject: 18 век
items.description: Русский литературный анекдот конца XVIII — начала  XIX века Место издания: Москва Издательство: Художественная литература Год издания: 1990 Количество страниц: 274 с. тираж: 500.000 экз.  Краткий исторический рассказ, микроновелла, острое изречение — все эти разновидности анекдота с античных времен сопутствовали большой литературе, дополняли официальную историю, биографии «знаменитых мужей». Расцвет литературного анекдота в русской культуре приходится на конец XVIII — первую половину XIX столетия.    В этой книге впервые представлены вместе анекдоты, любовно собранные и обработанные А. С. Пушкиным, П. А. Вяземским, Денисом Давыдовым и многими другими известными деятелями эпохи.  Среди персонажей сборника — литераторы, государственные деятели, военачальники, салонные говоруны, оригиналы и чудаки — русские люди в их частном и общественном быту
items.title: Русский литературный анекдот конца XVIII — начала XIX века (1990)

items.description: Concert Grande , hosted by Joe Patrych and Bruce Posner, aired on WFUV radio in New York City from July 1977 until July 1993. It featured keyboard performers, some of whom were also composers. This show aired on December 31, 1990, featuring highlights from piano recordings released that year. Liszt - Réminiscences de Lucia di Lammermoor (Leslie Howard) Leopold Godowsky - "Karneval" from Walzermasken (Ilona Prunyi) Mozart - Sonata in C Major, K.545, movement III, Rondo, Allegretto (Sviatoslav Richter) Chopin - Piano Concerto #2 in F Minor, Op. 21 - movement III, Allegro vivace (Jorge Bolet) NB: This show is an excerpt; the complete show has not been found.
items.title: Concert Grande - Year in Review, 12-31-1990 (excerpt)

items.description: This is the best selling Hatha Yoga book from my family. "Students often ask me which book I recommend they buy. My first answer is usually this book, Yoga: The Iyengar Way by Silva Mehta, Mira Mehta and Shyam Mehta. It is a large-format book that is beautifully illustrated with color and black and white photos. One of the nice things about the book is the models themselves, Mira and Shyam Mehta. Though their poses are elegant and advanced, their bodies are not intimidating in any way. A lot of poses are covered for such a concise book, with plenty of material for beginners and advanced students alike. Also included is a progressive course which will take you from raw beginner to advanced student."

items.description: The student yearbook of Piedmont College has been called The Yonahian since its first issue under that title in 1920, designated v. 1. Apparently, it was not published in 1921, since the issue for 1922 was marked v. 2. Since the issue for 1925 is marked v. 4, we believe that the yearbook was published in 1924 as v. 3. Unfortunately, the Library does not have a copy of the 1924 Yonahian. We also do not have copies of the Yonahian for 1938 and 1945, and we have no evidence to suggest whether it was published in those years.

items.description: This is a 1996 VHS issue of You Don't Look 40, Charlie Brown! The special, commemorating 40 years of Charles M. Schulz's Peanuts comic strip, originally aired February 2, 1990, on CBS. It was hosted by actress Michele Lee, star of CBS prime time drama Knots Landing . More information can be found in the special's Wikipedia entry: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/You_Don%27t_Look_40,_Charlie_Brown  The tape was played on a VCR connected to a RetroTINK-5X, which upscaled the 480i signal to 1080p with motion adaptive deinterlacing. The RT5X was in turn connected to an Elgato Game Capture 4K60 Pro Mk.2 and captured as an MKV file in OBS Studio. The beginnings and ends of the raw capture were edited out in Wondershare Filmora 12, where I normalized the audio and lowered the brightness and contrast. This video is the exported MP4.
items.title: You Don't Look 40, Charlie Brown!

I have uploaded each movie for posterity, with the hope that all present and future generations will learn from and enjoy them, as much as I have. I own zero rights to this film, nor to any other I have uploaded, and I receive nothing (no $) for the uploads nor for the information I put with those uploads. description: Synopsis: Women and men live in different worlds ... made of different words. Spending nearly four years on the New York Times bestseller list, this is the book that brought gender differences in ways of speaking to the forefront of public awareness. With a combination of scientific insight and humor, the author shows why women and men can walk away from the same conversation with completely different impressions of what was said. Studded with examples of real conversations, this book provides readers with the tools to understand what went wrong - and to find a common language in which to strengthen relationships at work and at home. A classic in the field of interpersonal relations, this book will change forever the way you approach conversations
items.title: You just don't understand : women and men in conversation

items.description: Your Computer September 1990 The Federal Publishing Company Features Monitors in focus - part 2 Stewart Fist considers the changes to PC display technology after IBM introduced EGA - and then brings the future into focus. Buying an entry level PC An 'entry level' PC is simply the basic system you need for the task at hand - it's your 'entry' to computing lake Kennedy describes how to make your first computer decisions effectively... Choosing and implementing a network Networking can be one of the most complex tasks a small business can face, but Mark Cheeseman makes it all come together, describing the approach to take and the pitfalls to avoid. The Stat of Queensland There's been a shakeout in the computer industry 'up north', but no-one there is talking 'recession'. Reviews Backing-up If your business depends on computers, backing-up is an essential task - but often neglected because it's a 'niusance'. John Hepworth tells how DS Backup, Fastback and SitBack can make it easy. The Spectacular Amiga 3000! Commodore's assault on the business market has left Gregg Faulkner without a wish list... For Users Industry updates IBM rewrites history; Acer buys Altos; new Australian Clipper destributor; Microsoft caught out by Windows 3 success; European PCs hit rock bottom; Unix battle lines drawn. Tech Tips Metric rulers in Corel Draw; Monochrome card update; Windows swap files; Hard disk maintenance; Voice coil drives; TIFFs and TIFFS. IBM memory management Brandt Dainow expands on memory: here he covers Dos memory management and the development of the current standards - next month, Windows memory managemenr, New Connections LaserJet printing for Novell; Two new modems for laptops; NewWave under NetWare; Networking Handbook. Release Updates Optical filing; EMS software; HyperCard 2.0; Education packs from Lotus; entry level CAD; 31MHz XT upgrade; Custom keyboards; Investment charting... and a host of new machines. National BBS Listing The Small Business Accountant: 'The hotline support is from accountancy firms - not technocrats!' IBM Underground Communication software 'TFE truly makes it a snack to edit your dialing directory, and rearrange it to meet your needs. Your Apple IIGS The IBM IIGS: 'I have never seen Apple II software that can draw circuit diagrams or develop printed circuit boards.' Vern V Shrunkle, MD (Honorary) PCs for Blokes: 'Our business problem was connecting everyone's burglar alarm to the network...' Write Bytes To Unix or not; Worth a legal copy; Presentation graphics
items.title: Your Computer September 1990

subject: Sony
HDVHS
8K
Rare Media
items.description: This is the legendary Sony high-definition 12" HDVS videodisc called "Metamorphosis" (HDP-1622) produced in limited numbers in Japan for demonstration. The HDVS disc format was designed to be a highly portable 12" laserdisc-derived media format for Sony's "High-Definition Video System" or "Hi-Vision" back in the early 1990's! Back then, high definition was a little different from how it is now. The majority of the signal was analog & close to but slightly different in resolution to the 1080i picture we receive over the air today as it was 1035i (hence the large upper border in the picture). Before the earliest high-definition media was available to the public (via satellite, MUSE Laserdisc, & W-VHS tapes), Sony and other companies began shooting footage, performing research, and showing public displays of high-definition television. There were three main ways of storing HDTV (or HDVS) at that time: Reel-to-reel tape (HDV/HDD-1000), cartridge tape (HDV-10 "UniHi"), & 12" Laserdisc-style discs (HDL-5800 / HDL-2000). This footage came from one of the Laserdisc-style discs. These HDVS discs could only hold a maximum of 15 minutes of video on CLV discs, even less on CAV discs...but it held uncompressed, raw high-definition component video! Take that, Blu-Ray! The disc itself was produced in 1990 but some segments were taped in the 1980's. The disc contains unique footage along with recycled footage from other early Sony HD titles such as the Hills Of The Seasons series & Coral Story. An interesting note is that the older Hills of The Seasons & Coral Story sequences were recorded using the 1984-era analog HDVS system (Sony HDV-1000) while some of the other sequences, such as scenes featuring the female model, were recorded using the 1988-era digital HDVS system (Sony HDD-1000). There is a noticeable increase in random noise for the older analog HDVS sequences. The audio track is encoded in Dolby Surround/Dolby Pro Logic (technically Dolby Stereo) so I'd highly recommend running this video through your favorite surround sound receiver! xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx This was played back on a Sony HDL-2000 Videodisc player which outputs analog component (1035i) video. Uploaded in upscaled 4K ProRes for extra clarity!
items.title: Yt 5s.com Sony's Metamorphosis ( 1990 Analog HDTV HDVS High Definition Dolby Surround Demonstration Videodisc)

Now, Yusuke is a ghost with a mission, performing good deeds at the behest of Botan, the ferrywoman of the River Styx, and Koenma, the pacifier-sucking judge of the dead. subject: ecological land classification
litterfall
N mineralization
nitrification
overstory biomass
items.description: Net N mineralization and nitrification were studied in three forest ecosystems to gain an understanding of the spatial and temporal variability of N transformations. The upland forests studied were two sugar maple ecosystems that differed in overstory associates and ground flora composition, and an oak ecosystem. Three stands in each ecosystem were sampled to provide spatial replication within a 250,000 ha area in northwestern Lower Michigan. Overstory biomass and annual increment were estimated using species-specific allometric biomass equations. Net N mineralization and nitrification were determined by an in situ buried polyethylene bag technique in which surface soil samples were incubated at monthly intervals for one year. Litter was collected during autumn in each ecosystem from one randomly selected stand. Aboveground biomass was lowest in the oak ecosystem (151 t ha-1) and greatest in the sugar maple-basswood/Osmorhiza ecosystem (209 t ha-1). Net annual N mineralization was 313 g N g-1 yr-1 in the oak ecosystem and was significantly less than annual mineralization in the two sugar maple ecosystems. Mineral N production in the sugar maple-basswood/Osmorhiza and sugar maple-red oak/Maianthemum ecosystems was 426 and 382 g N g-1 yr-1, respectively. Nitrification was greatest in the sugar maple-basswood/Osmorhiza ecosystem where 85% of mineral N was oxidized to NO3- (364 g N g-1 yr-1). Nitrification was minimal in the oak forest, totaling 6% of annual mineralization (18 g N g-1 yr-1). Results suggest that ecosystem types may be used to predict spatial patterns of N transformations at regional scales.
items.title: Spatial and temporal variability of nitrogen cycling in northern Lower Michigan

Джордж Турбервилль

items.description: Под ред. В. Л. Янина: вступ. ст., пер., комм. и сост. А. А. Севастьяновой. — Москва: Издательство МГУ, 1990. — 288 с. Издание содержит новый полный перевод сочинений агента английской торговой компании и дипломата Джерома Горсея, жившего в России в 70-90-е годы XVI в. Публикация включает три произведения Горсея, сообщающих важные, подчас уникальные сведения о политическом развитии русского государства в период царствования Ивана Грозного, Федора Ивановича и Бориса Годунова, торговле, внешней политике, опричнине, взаимоотношениях государства и церкви. Публикуемый перевод дает целый ряд новых трактовок текста, а во вступительной статье предлагаются наблюдения над происхождением этого ценного и малодоступного источника. В приложении помещены документы английской торговой компании, а также первый полный русский перевод поэтических посланий из России XVI в. англичанина Дж. Турбервилля. Издание иллюстрировано, содержит комментарии и указатели.  Содержание Предисловие Джером Горсей и его сочинения о России Издания и переводы сочинений Джерома Горсея (археографическое введение) Oт переводчика Таблица условно-однозначных соответствий Путешествия сэра Джерома Горсея Торжественная и пышная коронация Федора Ивановича, царя русского и проч., 10 июня 1584 года, увиденная мистером Джеромом Горсеем, джентльменом и слугой ее величества, человеком, много путешествовавшим и испытавшим в тех краях. Сюда же присоединено описание его путешествия по суше из Москвы в Эмден Трактат о втором и третьем посольствах мистера Джерома Горсея, эсквайра, ныне рыцаря, посланного от ее величества к царю России в 1585 и 1589 годах Приложение I Жалобы русской компании на Горсея Письма Джерома Горсея Приложение ІІ Джордж Турбервилль. Стихотворные послания-памфлеты из России XVI века Спенсеру Паркеру Данси Джордж Турбервилль. Послания из России (поэтическое переложение) Спенсеру Паркеру Данси
items.title: Записки о России: XVI - начало XVII в.

subject: AIDS/HIV Made In USA
Zears Miles
Dr. Robert Strecker
items.description: Interview with the late Zears L. Miles on the Truth About AIDS. The Interview was Titled "Wake Up", 11-19-1990. Interview was nearly three hours on AIDS/HIV as a Man-Made Disease. Zears Miles Lectured with Dr. Strecker and Dr. Strecker referred me to interviewing Mr. Zears Miles. Audio Files from Dave Emory Spitfirelist.com "The King Alfred Plan" The Final Solution For The Negro Problem (Listen REX-84 #3 If You Don't Have Time For The Complete Recordings 1-4) , added in four parts. Information came from Zears Miles and discussed in the Interview, "Wake Up".  The Audio, “The King Alfred, REX 84 Is From Dave Emory of  David Emory   c/o KFJC-FM   12345 El Monte Road   Los Altos Hills, CA 94022   About Dave Emory https://spitfirelist.com https://spitfirelist.com/for-the-record/ftr1187-the-oswald-institute-of-virology-part-6-context-part-2/   David Emory is a political researcher and broadcaster whose California-based radio programs are heard on a regular basis in the United States, Canada and Europe.   Mr. Emory’s broadcasts focus on the U.S. military and intelligence community’s historical involvement with international fascism. Researching such national security establishment abuses as domestic and foreign political assassinations, and governmental complicity with organized crime and drug smuggling syndicates, Mr. Emory has distilled his academic research into an archival documentary format. These “archive” programs consist of excerpts from printed sources read during his broadcasts.   Mr. Emory’s programs have been featured on a regular basis on Pacifica stations KPFK (Los Angeles) and WBAI (New York), and many smaller stations. He has appeared as guest on major commercial stations including KGO-AM (San Francisco) and WLUP-AM (Chicago) and as an expert commentator on broadcast outlets in three continents. Audio cassette copies of the archive programs are also circulated internationally.   Mr. Emory began his work during the Watergate era when he noted numerous connections between that scandal and the assassination of President Kennedy. Pursuing his work on the JFK assassination, Mr. Emory discovered Nazi General Reinhard Gehlen’s Eastern front spy apparatus, and its incorporation into the CIA after World War II. This led Mr. Emory to study the origins of fascism and its influence on the contemporary world. Mr. Emory graduated from Amherst College with a B.A. in psychology.
